questions.text: When is Steve's birthday?
questions.explanation:
June 6th.

	Steve was born in Long Island, New York.

questions.text: What instrument did Steve begin his musical journey on?
questions.explanation:
Accordian.

	Aged 11. He switched to guitar shortly afterward.

questions.text: How old was Steve when he joined Frank Zappa's band?
questions.explanation:
18.

	Steve transcribed an extremely complex Zappa piece called The Black Page, and sent it to Frank. Frank was so impressed he eventually took Steve on tour!

questions.text: Which guitar magazine did Steve work for as a transcriber at one point?
questions.explanation:
Guitar Player.

	He transcribed some really tough pieces, including music by Allan Holdsworth and Frank Zappa.

questions.text: Which two types of music did Steve study at Berklee Music College?
questions.explanation:
Jazz and Classical.

	It was apparently while Steve was at Berklee that the piece that later became 'Eugene's Trick Bag' took shape.

questions.text: What was Steve's character name in the 1986 movie 'Crossroads', where he played the Devil's guitarist?
questions.explanation:
Jack Butler.

	Steve wrote and performed the movie's showcase guitar piece, 'Eugene's Trick Bag' although in the film, thanks to some nifty fingering, it looks like Ralph Macchio is playing it!

questions.text: True or False: Steve played guitar for Frank Zappa on the album 'One Size Fits All'?
questions.explanation:
False.

	He did play on the excellently titled 'Ship arriving too late to save a drowning Witch', though, among others.

questions.text: What was the name of the band Steve formed with his sister when they were children?
questions.explanation:
Hot Chocolate.

	Hot Chocolate was also the name of the first song Steve ever wrote, with his sister, Lillian.

questions.text: True or False: Steve played in a Jimi Hendrix covers band?
questions.explanation:
True.

	The name of the band was Bold As Love. Steve was also in a band called Axis, but it wasn't a Hendrix covers band.

questions.text: Which track is number 11 on 'Passion & Warfare'?
questions.explanation:
Greasy Kid's Stuff.

	That's Steve talking at the start of the track.

questions.text: In what year did Steve release the Fire Garden album?
On Steve's album 'The Ultra Zone', track 5 is 'Jibboom'. Who does Steve tip his hat to in the sleeve notes for inspiring this tune?
questions.explanation:
Stevie Ray Vaughan.

	Jibboom is very similar to SRV's 'Scuttle Buttin' in places.

questions.text: Ibanez produced a limited edition run of JEM guitars at the turn of the millennium. What was odd about them?
questions.correct: Steve donated his blood to the paint mix.
options: Steve painted each of them himself
Steve strung them individually by himself
questions.explanation:
Steve donated his blood to the paint mix.

	They look similar to the guitar Steve has on the cover of "Passion & Warfare".

questions.text: Morley produced a volume pedal with input from Steve. What did they name it?
questions.explanation:
Little Alligator.

	In addition to Steve's Bad Horsie wah pedal.

questions.text: On which album would you find the track "I'll Be Around"
questions.explanation:
The Ultra Zone.

	Track 9.

questions.text: Steve released a record with a band he put together and named 'Vai'. Who sang lead vocals on this album?
questions.explanation:
Devin Townsend.

	He also sings in the band Strapping Young Lad.

questions.text: What was the name of the album?
questions.explanation:
Sex And Religion.

	From 1993.

questions.text: Steve played guitar with David Lee Roth's band. On which album was 'Hot dog and a shake'?
questions.explanation: Skyscraper.

questions.text: Under what pseudonym did Steve record on 1989's 'Guitar's Practicing Musicians' compilation album?
questions.explanation:
Reckless Fable.

	Steve contributed the track 'Western Vacation'

questions.text: Steve has a signature series amplifier now - made by Carvin. But can you name it?
questions.explanation:
Legacy.

	Developed with Steve's help!
